ComicInfo.Summary:
B&W reprints of full-page Sunday strips. Slim Jim always foils pursuit by Grassville Police force.
B&W reprints of full-page Sunday strips.
B&W reprint of full-page Sunday strip.
B&W reprints from full-page Saturday and Sunday comics. Slim Jim is a skinny vagabond always pursued by three members of the Grassville Police force.
Strips of an acrobatic vagabond being pursued by police.
Reprints from weekly humor magazine Judge. Nat is a W.C. Fields type of tramp, with a florid vocabulary.
Comic strip where a farmer tells his college student son to catch a pig.
Sam interacted with comic strip characters and settings from throughout the history of American comic strips. It appealed to comic strip aficianados, which was not enough readers to keep the strip alive.

ComicInfo.Title: Who's All Right? Slim Jim!; Oh You Hollanders! Look Out for Slim Jim!; Put the Tramps to Work - on "Eatin's"; No Slim-Jim, No Turkey! For the Grassville Police!; Circus Solly Abroad; A Tramp Around the Flagg Pole.; The Advantage of a College Education
